text: The voiced alveolar nasal is a type of consonant. Nearly all languages contain this sound. The letter for this sound in the International Phonetic Alphabet is ⟨⟩. The X-SAMPA symbol for this sound is `⟨n⟩`. The English language has this sound, and it is the sound represented by "n" in near and number. == Features == == Examples == Language Word IPA Meaning Adyghe /nėfnė 'light' Arabic Standard /nūr 'light' Assyrian ܢܘܪܐ nōra ] 'mirror' Basque 'I' Bengali /naak/nāk 'nose' Catalan 'snow' Chinese Mandarin / 'difficult' Czech 'on' Dutch 'night' English nice 'nice' Finnish 'I give' Georgian /k'ani 'skin' Greek / 'communion wine Gujarati /nahi 'no' Hawaiian 'to shake' Hebrew /navon 'wise' Italian 'dwarf' Irish 'peak' Japanese / 'opposite' Khmer 'kingdom' Korean / 'Country' Kurdish Northern 'animal' Central /gîyânlabar Southern Kyrgyz /banan 'banana' Malay 'cooked rice' Malayalam /kanni 'virgin' Maltese 'truncheon' Mapudungun 'enough' Ngwe Mmockngie dialect 'sun' Nepali /nakkal 'imitation' Odia /nāka 'nose' Persian نون/nun [nun] 'bread' Pirahã 'you' Polish 'punch' Punjabi ਨੱਕ/nakk 'nose' Slovak 'on' Slovene 'news' Spanish 'nothing' Swahili ndizi [n̩dizi] 'banana' Tagalog 'thin' Thai / [nɔːn] 'sleep' Turkish 'reason' Tamil /manasu 'mind', 'heart' Vietnamese 'you're going' Welsh 'grandmother' Western Apache 'cache' West Frisian 'neck' Yi / 'hurt' Zapotec Tilquiapan nanɨɨ 'lady' ==Notes== ==References== * * * * * * * * * * * * * Category:Consonants
title: Voiced alveolar nasal
